intro: Hieracium tephrocerinthe subsp. lanuzae, commonly known as the lanuzae hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, grassy habitats and is often found in open woodlands or meadows. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid conditions. This subspecies is notable for its distinct morphology and ecological adaptability.
